defects.name: Achilles Heel
defects.description: The character loses twice as many Health Points as normal from a particular attack form (e.g., silver for werewolves).

defects.name: Awkward Size
defects.description: The item is significantly larger than a human and harder to maneuver or conceal. Grants a bonus/penalty to ranged attacks depending on relative size.

defects.name: Bane
defects.description: The character is harmed by exposure to a substance or material. Contact damage varies based on exposure and rarity.

ranks.description: The Bane causes the character minor damage: 10 damage per round of exposure.
The Bane causes the character moderate damage: 20 damage per round of exposure.
The Bane causes the character major damage: 30 damage per round of exposure.

defects.name: Unique Defect: Big, Heavy, and Obvious
defects.description: You're impossible to miss—and not in a good way. Whether due to your massive size, thundering footsteps, gleaming armor, or crackling magical aura, you stand out in any crowd. Stealth is nearly impossible, subtlety isn't your style, and you'll often be the first target in any confrontation.

defects.name: Blind Fury
defects.description: Under certain triggers, the character enters an uncontrollable rage, attacking anyone nearby until calmed.

ranks.description: Initiating the Blind Fury is difficult; reverting to a normal emotional state is easy
Initiating the Blind Fury and reverting to a normal emotional state are both moderately difficult
Initiating the Blind Fury is easy; reverting to a normal emotional state is difficult

defects.name: Conditional Ownership
defects.description: The Companion or Item actually belongs to an organization, and its use is restricted or conditional.

ranks.description: Mild conditions are imposed on the object's ownership and usage
Strict conditions are imposed on the object's ownership and usage
Severe conditions are imposed on the object's ownership and usage

defects.name: Confined
defects.description: The character is restricted to a specific physical area and cannot leave it.

ranks.description: Confined to a large area (100 km radius), such as a single kingdom, country, or large city
Confined to a moderate area (1 km radius), such as a small town or large, multi-structure complex
Confined to a small area (100 m radius), such as a tiny village or single building

defects.name: Cursed
defects.description: The character suffers from a supernatural or divine curse that hinders their life.

defects.name: Easily Distracted
defects.description: The character is frequently distracted by specific triggers.

defects.name: Unique Defect: Extra Damage from all Attacks
defects.description: The character takes extra damage from all attacks.

ranks.description: Suffers 10 Extra Damage from all Attacks
Suffers 20 Extra Damage from all Attacks
Suffers 30 Extra Damage from all Attacks
Suffers 40 Extra Damage from all Attacks
Suffers 50 Extra Damage from all Attacks
Suffers 60 Extra Damage from all Attacks
Suffers 70 Extra Damage from all Attacks
Suffers 80 Extra Damage from all Attacks
Suffers 90 Extra Damage from all Attacks
Suffers 100 Extra Damage from all Attacks

defects.name: Fragile
defects.description: The character has fewer Health Points than expected for their stats.

defects.name: Hounded
defects.description: The character is constantly monitored or followed, making privacy difficult.

defects.name: Impaired Manipulation
defects.description: The ability to manipulate objects with hands or other appendages is one of the major advantages that humans have over other species. If a character lacks these abilities, due to natural design or an unfortunate accident, they will be at a significant disadvantage.

defects.name: Impaired Speech
defects.description: Character cannot easily communicate through spoken language. This may stem from natural design, injury, or species traits. Communication is severely limited or impossible.

defects.name: Inept Attack
defects.description: Character is poor at offensive combat. They suffer reduced accuracy, either generally or in certain types of attacks (melee, ranged, etc.).

defects.name: Inept Defence
defects.description: Character is ineffective at defending. They suffer a reduced ability to dodge or block, either generally or in specific types of combat.

defects.name: Involuntary Change
defects.description: Character changes form due to external triggers or stress. This applies to characters with the Alternate Form, Alternate Identity, or Merge attributes. The change is not under the character's control.

defects.name: Ism
defects.description: Character faces prejudice or systemic bias based on race, gender, species, appearance, or other identifying traits. Roleplaying boundaries should be discussed before use.

defects.name: Lifting Capacity
defects.description: The character's lifting capacity is reduced.

defects.name: Magnet
defects.description: Character attracts obsessive or amorous attention from others. This is not due to charisma, but some unseen fate or aura. Attention is usually unwanted and problematic.

defects.name: Marked
defects.description: Character bears a visible mark or trait that identifies them or makes them stand out. This can be a brand, birthmark, scar, tattoo, or even their entire species/race.

defects.name: Nemesis
defects.description: The character has someone in their life that actively interferes with their goals. This may be a professional, personal, or romantic rival. The Nemesis is persistent and disruptive, though not necessarily a mortal enemy.

defects.name: Nightmares
defects.description: The character is haunted by recurring nightmares, often tied to trauma, prophecy, or memories. These affect their rest and performance.

defects.name: Obligated
defects.description: The character is controlled or indebted to an organization or individual. This obligation may stem from legal, technological, or psychological control.

defects.name: Phobia
defects.description: The character has an irrational fear of a specific object, event, or person. It limits choices and behaviors when triggered.

defects.name: Physical Impairment
defects.description: The character has a debilitating condition such as a missing limb, chronic illness, or recurring injury that impedes their daily function.

defects.name: Red Tape
defects.description: The character must navigate bureaucracy to act. This may include pre- or post-action paperwork or organizational obstacles.

defects.name: Reduced Damage
defects.description: The character inflicts reduced damage in combat, possibly due to feebleness, lack of combat experience, or youth.

defects.name: Running Speed
defects.description: The character's running speed is reduced.

defects.name: Sensory Impairment
defects.description: One or more of the character's senses (sight, hearing, taste, touch, smell) are either diminished or lost.

defects.name: Shortcoming
defects.description: A character has a deficiency in one or more aspects of a Stat that is lower than the rest of the Stat.

defects.name: Significant Other
defects.description: The character has someone they are deeply devoted to protecting, often at great personal risk.

defects.name: Skeleton in the Closet
defects.description: The character has a dark secret that could cause them harm if exposed.

defects.name: Social Fault
defects.description: The character exhibits a Social Fault that produces hardship for either the character or their companions and allies (or both).

defects.name: Special Requirement
defects.description: The character has a Special Requirement that must be fulfilled in order for them to continue to function normally.

defects.name: Strength Damage
defects.description: The character's damage from Strength attacks is reduced.

defects.name: Unappealing
defects.description: An Unappealing character may find it difficult to blend into a crowd because their appearance is distinctive.

defects.name: Lesser Unique Defect
defects.description: A minor unique defect that affects the character in a specific way. Each rank provides 1 CP refund.

ranks.description: Minor unique defect with slight impact
Minor unique defect with moderate impact
Minor unique defect with significant impact

defects.name: Greater Unique Defect
defects.description: A significant unique defect that affects the character in a major way. Each rank provides 2 CP refund.

ranks.description: Major unique defect with moderate impact
Major unique defect with significant impact
Major unique defect with severe impact

defects.name: Serious Unique Defect
defects.description: A severe unique defect that affects the character in a critical way. Each rank provides 3 CP refund.

ranks.description: Severe unique defect with significant impact
Severe unique defect with severe impact
Severe unique defect with critical impact

defects.name: Thrown Weapon Distance
defects.description: The character's thrown weapons have a decreased range.

defects.name: Vulnerability
defects.description: The character has a critical weakness to a specific object, environment, thought, activity, or condition.

defects.name: Wanted
defects.description: The character is Wanted by the law, a criminal, or a powerful organization.

defects.name: Weak Point
defects.description: The character has a physical Weak Point that causes double damage or instant defeat if struck.
